author: Neil Scott
comment: This is fine for a simple and free speedo, works fine with the GPS on the watch (Sony Smartwatch 3), but I need tenths of a knot (for sailing dinghies) and would like to be able to install-on/move-to the SD card of my phone as it has very little memory (LG Wine). Thanks.

author: Chaitanya Katpatal
comment: Sometimes inaccurate, but overall consistent

author: Ryan Whitaker
comment: Light, minimal, & accurate. Couldn't ask for more!

author: Bob Plus
comment: Good on fossil

author: Barna Péter
comment: Nice

author: Yashal Shakti
comment: I have nexus 5 rooted on 5.1 with location enabled along with moto 360 first gen . I tried for a few days and the speed never crossed 0.  Is there a solution and subsequently a way to increase the review rating.

reply.author: Daniel Gauci
reply.content: Sorry to hear that you are having this issue with Speed Wear. Two solutions that come to mind are to try clearing the app data, and if that does not work try uninstalling and reinstalling the application again. Restarting both the watch and the phone could also help. If you still have this issues, feel free to contact me via email.

title: Speed stuck at 0

author: Collin Lorenzo
comment: If you have any problems, the developer is awesome about responding to comments. I've had this app, and it works great, but that's not what impressed me the most. I've  been reading the reviews and he actually reads your comments, and replies. You get a lot of devs now that just copy and paste replies to reviews, but this guy is one of a kind. Even if I were to think this is a 3 star app, I would still give it 5 stars to promote the developer.
title: Great app

author: Radie Maliki
comment: For those having issues with it showing 0 - just turn off and on your location services (quick it you have the buttons in your notification bar). I have a Huawei watch and this works for me.   One suggestion I could make is to average the speed over a longer distance when it is over 80km/h. I use this when I drive on the freeway going a solid 110km/h on a straight using cruise control and it will show a range between 109 and 111.

author: Dennis Pishev
comment: Tested with Huawei Watch, location services on, but it kept showing 0. The speed was about 30 km/h. The rest of the data sowed 0 as well. Deleting.
title: Doesn't really work.

author: Kevin Lee
comment: There really should be a top speed reset feature.  The only way to do this now is to uninstall and install it again.  Think having a calculator without a Clear button

reply.author: Daniel Gauci
reply.content: Thank you for your feedback. Top speed can be reset by holding the pressing and holding on your current speed.

title: Missing feature

author: Paul Cash
comment: Disconnects my cars Bluetooth when it's running car reconnects when I exit the app on my watch.
title: Works good but...

author: Jan Duniec
comment: but when i ride bike i not always have watch on (sleep) and when i'm making wrist move it shows speed from time when wach was awake (and i have max speed lost - max speed when wach was not awake). can u fix it?

reply.author: Daniel Gauci
reply.content: Thanks for your review. I'll look into the issues mentioned and try to implement the fixes in the next update.

title: First thanks for max speed!

author: Jacky Lim
comment: I'm looking for a speedometer that can give out notification/vibration on a preset speed. It is useful for driver wanted stay on legal speed on a highway without keep looking at dashboard.
title: Feature request

author: Niall McGuinness
comment: This is a great app. Using it with my Sony smartwatch 3. As soon as I start moving on my motorbike speed wear starts. Perfect. Mr developer how do I zero the top speed for another journey.  I've only used your app on one journey so far. Thx in advance.
title: So good

author: Hubert Rynkowski
comment: Ok but there is no way to reset average speed without reinstalling app
title: Meh average

author: Bryan Lazdo
comment: I't say please launch speed wear from your android wear? Huh

reply.author: Daniel Gauci
reply.content: Since this is an Android Wear app, it needs to be launched on your Android Wear device.

title: Please launch what does that mean

author: Brandon Adams
comment: Just takes to long to get the speed to shoes on your watch. IT took a few minutes to show something other than 0mph. Once it starts it works
title: Works 👍

author: The Real Stuff
comment: I downloaded the watch face, and I opened the speed wear application on my phone. It then told me to lauch speed wear from my watch. I tried to find the speedwear watch face on my watch, although i couldn't. Please help.
title: Can't find app on watch

author: A Nonymous
comment: Stays at 0 with each setting mph/km/knots...

reply.author: Daniel Gauci
reply.content: Make sure that your phone's GPS is enabled. The Zenwatch doesn't have a built-in GPS and as such relies on your phone's GPS.

title: Doesnt work with zenwatch

author: 莊鏗齡
comment: If you have a moto360, don't download. It won't work

reply.author: Daniel Gauci
reply.content: The app worked well on all the Moto 360s that I tested it on. Is it possible to provide further information as to what is not working? Thanks.

author: B Rose
comment: I have a Sony Smartwatch 3 and it won't use the watch's built-in GPS. It will only use the phone's gps so it was not what I was hoping for when running/hiking without my phone.

reply.author: Daniel Gauci
reply.content: While I do not own a device with a built-in GPS, the app seems to work perfectly for other users that own a Smartwatch 3. Reasons that come to mind as to why it might not be working are mostly related to outdated software, such as Google Play Services. If the issue persists, feel free to contact me via email.

title: Sony Sw3

author: Gerda Diteriha
comment: When I am in a car or bus sometimes takes a lot of time to notice movements. But all in all works ok
title: Mostly works

author: Cawanz cawan iz
comment: It capture gps speed. But must always ON at watch. Would be nice if there speedometer analog option.
title: Nice!

author: Timothy Stewart
comment: Great app to have! Supprisingly, it is quite accurate, but I don't know how to reset the top speed
title: Works well!

author: Jerry Olshan
comment: Doesn't Work with Samsung Gear S2

author: Mandeep Singh
comment: The speedometer is not increasing while I'm on the go.. please help.
title: Not responding

comment: Will be interesting to set a limit and watch announce that limit. (Vibrate)

reply.author: Daniel Gauci
reply.content:
Hi Emil,

We will consider adding this feature in the future.

Thanks for the feedback!

title: Speed limit

author: Edward Cunliffe
comment: Works great for me, how do you zero the max and average speeds?
title: Sony Smartwatch 3

author: Thien Phuc
comment: Lg g watch r

reply.author: Daniel Gauci
reply.content: The application was tested on an LG G Watch R and it installed perfectly. Please try restarting your watch and phone. If this does not work, go into the Android Wear app and select 'Re-sync apps' from the settings menu. If the issue persists, please feel free to contact me.

title: App does not install on watch

author: Lui Yay
comment: Good for a smart watch :) I mean awesome for both ;)
title: Nice style and everything

author: Anirudh Niyogi
comment: Its good but it would be amazing if it had 0-100/0-60 counter ...
title: Need 0-60/0-100

author: mario gauci
comment: I give it 5 stars for the design and how it works great job.

author: Kelly Qualls
comment: Great. Shows current, fastest and average speeds.
title: Cool

author: Ryan Clayton
comment: Speed always zero
title: Doesn't work.

author: Gergo Viczian
comment: Nice!

author: Dan Suhr
comment: Man, Was I happy I found this. I installed it and I seems like it will perfectly suit my needs for my bike ride. Strava's Wear option is crap. They only give you average speed and elapsed time. Both really unimportant on a ride. Current speed is what is important. Thanks.  Edit: It would be helpful if the speeds were in 1/10 MPH/KPM/Knots.
title: Exactly what I was looking for...

author: Leo Espinoza Leo Espinoza Leo Espinoza Leo Espinoza
comment: I threw my watch and broke it and now the app doesnt work. Life is hard.
title: BROKEN

author: Kenneth Zerafa
comment: Works without calling attention to itself. Its also shows the top speed and average. Well done!
title: Very well designed app

author: Charles Nguyen
comment: Sometimes it's better to keep designs simple. This app has the function I need with the style I want. Great developer.
title: Great minimalistic design!
